subtitle: The classic - double-out
instructions:
You start with a score of 301. On your turn (called a visit), throw three darts and subtract the total from your score.

Your goal is to reach exactly zero, finishing on a double.

If your score drops below zero, or you're left on 1, the turn is a bust and your score returns to what it was before you threw.

The first player to check out on zero wins.

A perfect game?
The fewest visits you can finish 301 in is two — incredibly rare:
- Visit 1: 180 (T20 T20 T20)
- Visit 2: 121 checkout (T20, 11, D20)

subtitle: The professional standard
instructions:
You start with a score of 501. On your turn (called a visit), throw three darts and subtract the total from your score.

Your goal is to reach exactly zero, finishing on a double.

If your score drops below zero, or you're left on 1, the turn is a bust and your score returns to what it was before you threw.

The first player to check out on zero wins.

The perfect leg:
The fewest visits you can finish 501 in is three — the famous nine-dart finish:
- Visit 1: 180
- Visit 2: 180
- Visit 3: 141 checkout (T20, T19, D12)

title: Halve-It
subtitle: No one escapes the chop
instructions:
Halve-It is a six-round challenge of accuracy. You start on zero, and each round sets a single target to aim for.

On your turn (a visit), you throw three darts at that target. Every hit scores its value. Miss with all three, and your score is cut in half — the Chop.

A score can never drop below zero.

Example:
If you're on 10 points and the target is 5, hitting 5 with all three darts scores 15, taking you to 25.
If you miss the target with all three, your score is halved from 10 to 5.

Choose your difficulty and the app will set the six targets for you:
- Easy: mostly singles
- Medium: singles and doubles
- Hard: more doubles and trebles
- Pro: all doubles and trebles

After all six rounds, the highest score wins.

title: Knockout
subtitle: Let's get ready to rumble
instructions:
Choose your players, set the number of lives, and hit Start — the app shuffles the throwing order.

On your turn (a visit), you throw three darts and try to beat the current high score.

The first player's visit sets the initial score to beat.

Each time a player beats the high score, their total becomes the new high score to beat.

Players who fail to beat the current high score lose a life.

Play continues in order until only one player remains standing and everyone else has been knocked out.

title: Sudden Death
subtitle: One slip and you’re history
instructions:
Sudden Death is fast, simple, and unforgiving. Each round, every player throws three darts, and the player with the lowest total is eliminated.

All scores reset at the start of each new round — everyone begins even, but only for a moment.

Round after round, one player falls, until only one remains.

The last player standing wins.

title: English Cricket
subtitle: Take Wickets. Chase Runs.
instructions:
English Cricket is played with a batter and a bowler, just like the real game. You can play one-on-one or in teams.

As the batting side, your goal is to score as many runs as you can by hitting the scoring numbers: 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 20, and the bullseye.

As the bowling side, you're aiming for the bull to take wickets:
- Outer bull = 1 wicket
- Inner bullseye = 2 wickets

Once the bowling side reaches 10 wickets, the batting innings ends, and the roles swap.

After both sides have batted, the team with the highest total wins.

title: Killer
subtitle: It's Kill or Be Killed
instructions:
You start the game with a randomly assigned number between 1 and 20. No two players share the same number.

Your goal is simple: become a Killer, take lives from others, and be the last player standing.

To become a Killer, you must hit the double of your own number.

Once you're a Killer, hit the double of another player's number and they lose a life.

Be careful — hitting your own number (single, double, or treble) can cost you a life. You can regain lives by hitting your own number again.

Play continues as players pick each other off.
The last player with one or more lives wins.
